article.class: post-5472 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news

section.p: April 17, 2020 Vanguard Families, We are now three weeks into our offsite/online learning experience. Yesterday, Governor Tony Evers announced that school buildings would remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. Officially, the Safer at Home order will be extended from April 24, 2020, to 8 a.m. Tuesday, May 26, 2020, or […]

article.class: post-5462 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news

section.p: We’re here to help! Please, please reach out to us if you need ANYTHING. We are here to support you, problem-solve with you, and listen. We can connect you to community resources and/or help you navigate the distance learning waters. Julie Horner, School Psychologist – jhorner@wisheights.k12.wi.us (608) 767-2595 x4192 Katy Howe, […]

header.p: April 2, 2020 by Bev Whalen - Black Earth Elementary School, Mazomanie Elementary School, News, Wisconsin Heights Middle & High School, Wisconsin Heights School District

section.p: Beginning on April 6, families will be provided with 10 bagged meals (i.e. 5 lunches and 5 breakfasts) per child at a time, one time per week. Meals will be provided between 11:00 AM and 12:00 PM at Black Earth Elementary and Mazomanie Elementary on Mondays and Wednesdays only. Bagged meals are available for free […]

section.p: While schools are closed the Wisconsin Heights School District will be offering food service for pick-up from Tuesday, March 17th–Friday, March 20th and Monday, March 30th–Friday, April 3rd. This service will NOT be available during the week of March 23rd–March 27th which is our scheduled Spring Break. Food service is available to all children 18 […]
